People like to play champions to maximize their main role. If you play a 'meta' ADC champion and purchase items that don't maximize their AD, AS, or Crit % you're clearly a troll. I think that kind of mentality is the reason people say the League community is so toxic. Everyone forgets the fact that it's a free to play game. You don't need to take everything so seriously. Have fun!

It depends on the champion. If you one to play ranked, you must aim to win the game (if you just want to have fun, go play normals, that's why they exist, for you to have fun without aiming to win).

Ok, you want to win a game, let's go play ranked.

**Do you want to play AP Kog'Maw?** Fine, it is viable and has his strengths and weaknesses like every other champion.
**Do you want to play AP Malphite?** The same, it's fine.
**Do you want to play AP Varus?** The same again. In fact, AP Varus is AMAZING.
**Do you want to play AP Zed?** You are a troll. There is literally nothing an AP Zed can do better than a "standard" Zed would.
**Do you want to play AP Caitlyn?** The same, she has only two AP-scaling abilities and none of them are reliable if you want to do damage (which is the only reason you would buy AP). So you are a troll.
**Do you want to play Teemo?** Deserved permaban.

I took Diana top last night and my team flamed me champ select for a "Bad pick" we needed an AD Top they said.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1787104013/202703050?tab=overview - We absolutely wrecked them as Kha couldn't jump on any squishies without me deleting him, but mid way through the game mid was flaming bot for feeding, then started flaming me for "KS'ing" - people are going to call you a troll no matter what in some games.  Just play through.

If they say you are a troll at champion select, they will call you a troll the whole game even if you are 100/-1/100.

I have had games where I picked a "non-traditional" champion, I carried a team of feeders (things like myself being 20/0 and our team overall being 20/30) and still they called me troll...

I get your point, but League isn't just about winning lanes.

Mages and Assassins provides the team with burst or wave clear that can't be done with other archetypes of champions. Melee Bruisers pretty much beats everyone else in lane; however, they compensate it with a weaker late game. 
It's fine that you may pick Darius to counter a Zed or Talon, but you cannot stop that Zed or Talon to assassinate your ADC in a teamfight unless you absolutely shut him down in lane. While on the other hand, your team will have two top lane champions that can't dish out on demand burst such as Lux's laser or game changing CCs such as Orianna's shockwave. 

Besides, there are plenty of alternatives to countering assassins that is also generally played mid. Morgana can force any melee assassins to back off with her ult, and Galio is essentially immune to burst damage early game.

Malphite (tank), Jarvan or Riven have been played at LCS as mid.

In fact, LCS "pros" can be quoted saying things like "you can play almost every champion at solo lane, it will work". Keane (the one who picked Urgot mid against Zed) said recently that you can play almost every top at mid and vice versa, and it will work.

I main mid and I love playing "weird" things, usually because they are strong against popular picks (Pick Jarvan or Urgot and enjoy wrecking Zeds), because they are too oppressive (full AP Malphite or tank Cho'Gath) or just because people don't know how to handle them (Quinn). And I usually have a good time winning my lane easily and thus, giving a great advantage to my whole team (For example, killing and denying farm to the enemy assassin so they can't afford items, and they can't kill my carry. My carry just doesn't care about the enemy assassin anymore, because they won't shut them down fast enough to be a threat).

On topic, I agree :p
I play {{champion:11}} , {{champion:59}} , and {{champion:114}} mid.
They're pretty much assassins when allowed to be played as glass cannons.
Yi and Fiora are usually build glass cannon anyway. Nobody expects just how strong lane Yi is early on..

Yi has one of the weakest laning phases.

No good base damages, mana-hungry, no escapes.

There is a reason he is taken as a jungler.

Only place I can make Yi lane work is on my smurf.

His E gives him +10% AD, which makes last hitting under tower a breeze, he is only mana hungry if you spam your Q (which you shouldn't as a lane Yi), and W's damage reduction and heal make him deceptively survivable in early level all-ins.

He can trade really well by proccing Double strike with E active for a potent split second trade for ~200% AD as well.

Yi isn't amazing in lane, but he isn't that bad at all (he actually counters some assassins like Zed).
I've seen it work a couple times, I assume it's just because you get a couple minutes of your lane opponent wiffing spells into your Q/W, and hopefully you've carved out a lead before they wisen up.

Yeah, whenever I lane as Yi, I don't pick him to bully my opponent or anything, I focus on getting every single last hit (my usual goal is to miss no more than 3-4 creeps before my first back when I buy brutalizer and boots). Yi doesn't get ahead from a lot of early kills on his opponent, he gets ahead by out farming and getting kills in the mid game.
Well that is because Yi Meditate is very good at countering burst especially from someone like Zed who can't CC and punish Yi for meditating
